entries.femaleVariant: You're... late!
I... found a companion along the way.
Someone from the studio?
V, meet Zuleikha.
Zuleikha is the sister of the man I killed.
She wrote me letters while I was doing time.
Joshua Stephenson... we meet again. And who are you?
[Stand] Let's go.
[Stand] Had enough of this, Josh. I'm out.
We should leave. Really.
Had enough of this, Josh.
Please, Mrs. El-Ahmar!
Wait!
Do you remember what you wrote me in your last letter? She is everything you spoke of.
entries.maleVariant: Do you remember what you wrote me in your last letter? He is everything you spoke of.

entries.femaleVariant: Fuck off.
V. Pleasure.
Nice to meet ya.
Wouldn't mind knowin' what's goin' on here. Anyone?
Really wouldn't mind knowing what's going on.
You haven't told her anything?
We just met. There wasn't time.
Mama isn't... back yet. We can talk inside until she returns. Come in.
Mmm.
You are a friend of Joshua's?
You really are insane…
Recent acquaintance, more like.
It's complicated.
Nope, not friends.
Recent acquaintance, more like.
It's a long, strange story…
Nope. We are not friends.
Hehh...
Mama isn't... back yet. We can talk inside until she returns. Come in.
Don't know how you can forgive someone for that.
Why are we here?
Joshua found redemption because of you?
Mean to say you let the man who killed your brother off the hook?
entries.maleVariant: You mean to say, you let the man who killed your brother off the hook?

entries.femaleVariant: You're the reason Joshua found redemption?
Why're we here? And who're we waitin' for?
That is how we two were united. Through forgiveness.
"Judge not, and you will not be judged. Condemn not, and you will not be condemned. Forgive, and you will be forgiven."
It was her letter that started everything.
I lost a brother. God gave me another.
Your God allowed innocent people to die.
True believers – hard to come by these days.
Not buyin' it. Not at all.
entries.maleVariant: I'm not buyin' it, not at all.

entries.femaleVariant: Not every day you run into a true believer in Night City.
entries.maleVariant: It's not every day you run into a true believer in Night City.

entries.femaleVariant: You believe in a merciful God. Yet he allowed for your brother's murder. Let it happen.
Why are we here?
I grieved for Ruben. You cannot know how much. I wanted him back... But then God showed me his plan, and I found peace.
The Lord knows I regret killing Ruben, but... if not for him, I never would have found the path to God.
Still not buyin' it.
So it was all Divine Providence?
Yep, still not buyin' it.
We can't know the paths of Divine Providence.
It was Providence that brought you under my roof. We met because of Him.
Do you believe in God, V?
I guess, then... you don't believe in the Creator?
Yes, I do.
Nope.
Could be some higher power.
Sure, I believe.
Can't say I do.
For all I know there could be a higher power out there, but nobody's been able to prove it. No one ever will.
Why're we even talking about this?
Why're we even talking about this?
Faith is something no one but you can prove.
Zuleikha and I have a... a running dispute. I was thinking you could help us resolve it.
Whether it finds enemies or neighbors, God's love knows no bounds on Earth, and neither should ours.
Tell me, V. Do you believe in God?
No, no, I never agreed to anything like this!
I'm all ears.
Religious debates – not really my thing.
I'm all ears.
Eh, religious debates – not my thing.
Joshua, he... he thinks he's the Messiah and wants to end his own life.
That is not true – I never said I was any sort of messiah.
Suicide! Do you really think that's what the Lord could ever want from you?
It won't be suicide.
Whoa. Insane, that's what this is.
Zuleikha, tell me what's going on.
What exactly's going on here, Joshua?
entries.maleVariant: What exactly's going on here, Josh?

entries.femaleVariant: I still don't get what's happening here, Zuleikha.
When the media learned I'd found God in prison, the next day my face was on the cover of every screamsheet.
A braindance studio took notice. They sent representatives to make me an offer.
Egh, bloodsuckers...
I was facing the electric chair. Now, with the studio's help, my death will be more than a state-sanctioned murder.
They want to scroll a braindance of Joshua being crucified – an execution like any other, just garbed in holy robes!
Why the braindance? What do you hope to achieve?
Law's got nothing to say about this?
Hang on. A... a BD studio changed how a convict's going to be executed? Doesn't the law say something about that?
entries.maleVariant: Wha-- hang on. A BD studio changed how a convict's going to be executed? Doesn't the law say somethin' about that?

entries.femaleVariant: Corps write the laws. Corps choose the judges. All it takes is a sit-down between the studio's CEO and a state's attorney.
Officially, I'm here on a supervised, one-day furlough. But no law can prevent me from spending that with new acquaintances.
When they put Joshua away, the screamsheets devoted space to him on page five.
But when they discovered he'd found God, suddenly he was on primetime TV.
What's wrong with using a platform to tell people about my faith, and God's grace, hm?
We are way past that, Joshua! Instead of being executed in prison, he agreed to let braindance studio vultures record his agony as he's being crucified!
Corruption's a sin, too, isn't it? And corruption got you here.
This is much bigger than the laws of man. With this braindance, I'll take God's message to billions.
This is insanity, pure and simple.
W-why the braindance? What's in it for you?
entries.maleVariant: Why the braindance? Wh-what's in it for you?

entries.femaleVariant: It's the one thing worse than insanity – blasphemy.
Zuleikha transformed me into a child of God. It's time I repaid that debt.
Think of the millions jacked into their feeds like livestock, the children growing up in gang-infested streets. Do they know love?
Think of the joytoys on Jig-Jig Street! Coked-out corpos in their offices, an' murderers who stalk the streets! I want to reach them. I will reach them!
And think of paid killers like you, V. Have you known love? Do you know what it is?
Uh, mother's home!
Tell me, V. Do you believe in God?
There's nothing to debate. Those BD studio hyenas convinced Joshua to trade one execution for another – his own crucifixion.
He wants everyone to experience his agony! Feel his pain and suffering!
I want to bear witness to love's existence – in a manner that all the lost souls on this wretched earth can understand.
Why love?
If unconditional love exists, then so must God! It's time the world was reminded of His divine presence.
Name's V.
She the one we've been waiting for?
My name is V.
This who we've been waiting for?
Go. You are not welcome here.
Yes.
Mrs. El-Ahmar... I have come to beg you for forgiveness.
You... You murdered my son!
That is something I can never forgive.
Out of my house, now!
Out! All of you!
I truly do regret the pain I have caused you…
Nope, count me out.
Zuleikha..?
[Sit] Water'd be fine.
Please, sit down.
Can I offer you anything, a drink?
[Sit] Something... strong?
[Sit] I'm good, thanks.
Uh, glass of water.
Think I could have something... stronger, maybe?
entries.maleVariant: Think I could have somethin'... stronger, maybe?

entries.femaleVariant: I'm good, thanks.
Please.
We do not serve any alcohol under this roof. We have none.
You took my Ruben from me…
My child, my son…
You killed my child!
My Ruben...
In the name of Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit, One God. Amen.
Murderer!
It's OK, just go.
Mrs. El-Ahmar! Please!
Just go, please...
Not a fan of waiting, huh?
Looks like someone doesn't enjoy waiting patiently.
entries.maleVariant: Looks like someone doesn't enjoy waitin' patiently.

entries.femaleVariant: Vasquez, keep an eye on them. I'm gonna stay in the car.
Keep it short. We're on a tight schedule.
Hurry up. I'll be waitin' outside.
Joshua, care to explain?
Let's go back to the car.
[Get out]
[Drink]
[Get in]
Is everything all right?
Hello?
